alert.note: Alert for Cass; Gage; Jefferson; Johnson; Lancaster; Nemaha; Otoe; Pawnee; Richardson; Saline (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 10:41AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
